p: The region of Fez-Meknes is located in the northern center of Morocco (34° 02′00 ″north, 500′00″ west), integrating part of the Saïss plain alongside the mountain ranges of the Rif and the Middle Atlas, and it stretches over an area of 40.075 km 2 representing 5.7% of the national territory. It is geographically limited by the Tangier-Tetouan-Al Hoceima region in the north, the Rabat-Sale-Kenitra region in the west, the Oriental region in the east, the Beni Mellal-Khenifra region in the southwest, and the region of Drâa-Tafilalet in the South [ 8].
